qas.question: When did efforts begin to try and identify the origins of Ashkenazi Jews through DNA analysis?
How many types of genetic origin testing currently exist?

answers.text: three types of genetic origin testing

qas.question: What are the three types of origin testing?

answers.text: autosomal DNA (atDNA), mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA), and Y-chromosomal DNA (Y-DNA)
a mixture from an individual's entire ancestry
a male's lineage only along his strict-paternal line

context: Efforts to identify the origins of Ashkenazi Jews through DNA analysis began in <a0_0>the 1990s<a0_0/>. Currently, there are <a1_0>three types of genetic origin testing<a1_0/>, <a2_0>autosomal DNA (atDNA), mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA), and Y-chromosomal DNA (Y-DNA)<a2_0/>. Autosomal DNA is <a3_0>a mixture from an individual's entire ancestry<a3_0/>, Y-DNA shows <a4_0>a male's lineage only along his strict-paternal line<a4_0/>, mtDNA shows any person's lineage only along the strict-maternal line. Genome-wide association studies have also been employed to yield findings relevant to genetic origins.
